pl.coderslab.app

Class OddsCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.coderslab.app.OddsCalculator

  • @Component
public class OddsCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    OddsCalculator is a class containing various methods for generating odds of football matches. All methods assume that we have data regarding strengths of football teams. Strength is a value from 0 to 1, and is expected to be a value calculated for each team basing of earlier games e.g. 0.6 - means that a team scores at least 1 goal in 60% matches (form historical. Some of this class methods include time parameter and current scores - for live bets. Statistical equations found at: https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/168411/probability-of-a-team-scoring-a-goal Implemented and adjusted by Karol Nurzynski TO DO: Change from double to BigDecimal

      static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calcProbabilityOfGoals(double strengthA)
      This method calculates the probability of goals from 0 to 4 goals, based on team strength (probability of scoring at least 1 goal) and redistributes this probability into 5 events using Poisson model - see OddsCalculator description
      static double calcTimeToEndRation(java.time.LocalTime totalTime, java.time.LocalTime leftTime)
      This is a method helping in calculation of time to end of game ratio.
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> calculateMapOfResultProbabilityAB(double strengthA, double strengthB)
      This method returns a map o results, where key is in format ab (a = goals scored by b; b = goals scored by a) and values represents the probability of this event
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDraw(double strengthA, double strengthB) 
      static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDrawInclTimeAndCurrentResult(double strengthA, double strengthB, double timeToEndRatio, int scoreA, int scoreB)
      This method is similar to calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDraw(double, double) but this one includes to additional parameters - time and current game result (score A and score B)

    • Method Detail

      • calcProbabilityOfGoals

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calcProbabilityOfGoals(double strengthA)
        This method calculates the probability of goals from 0 to 4 goals, based on team strength (probability of scoring at least 1 goal) and redistributes this probability into 5 events using Poisson model - see OddsCalculator description
        Parameters:
        strengthA - is a strength of a team, which is the probability that team scores 1 or more goals. Strength should be less than 1 and more than 0.
        Returns:
        is the list of probailities of scoring 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4(or more) goals by the team

      • calculateMapOfResultProbabilityAB

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> calculateMapOfResultProbabilityAB(double strengthA,
                                                                                                 double strengthB)
        This method returns a map o results, where key is in format ab (a = goals scored by b; b = goals scored by a) and values represents the probability of this event
        Parameters:
        strengthA - is the probability that teamA scores at least 1 goal (received values from 0 to 1)
        strengthB - is the probability that teamB scores at least 1 goal (received values from 0 to 1)
        Returns:
        is a map of results e.g. key = 01, means game result teamA 0 : teamB 1; values is the probability of this result

      • calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDraw

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDraw(double strengthA,
                                                                                  double strengthB)
        Parameters:
        strengthA - is the probability that teamA scores at least 1 goal (received values from 0 to 1)
        strengthB - strengthB is the probability that teamB scores at least 1 goal (received values from 0 to 1)
        Returns:
        is a 3-element list, where first is the probability than team A wins, 2 - team B wins, 3 - draw

      • calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDrawInclTimeAndCurrentResult

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDrawInclTimeAndCurrentResult(double strengthA,
                                                                                                          double strengthB,
                                                                                                          double timeToEndRatio,
                                                                                                          int scoreA,
                                                                                                          int scoreB)
        This method is similar to calculateProbabilityAwinsBwinsDraw(double, double) but this one includes to additional parameters - time and current game result (score A and score B)
        Parameters:
        strengthA - is the probability that teamA scores at least 1 goal (received values from 0 to 1)
        strengthB - strengthB is the probability that teamB scores at least 1 goal (received values from 0 to 1
        timeToEndRatio - is the ration of time left, where 1 is full time (normally 90 minutes); 0.5 would mean 45minutes left
        scoreA - is number of goals scored by team A for which probability is calculated
        scoreB - is number of goals scored by team B for which probability is calculated
        Returns:
        is a 3-element list of probabilities, where first is the probability that team A wins, second - team B wins, third - draw

      • calcTimeToEndRation

        public static double calcTimeToEndRation(java.time.LocalTime totalTime,
                                         java.time.LocalTime leftTime)
        This is a method helping in calculation of time to end of game ratio.
        Parameters:
        totalTime - is total game time, for football mathces normally 90 minutes
        leftTime - is time left to game end - e.g.45 minutes left
        Returns:
        is the ration of time to end e.g. 45/90 = 0.5
